WHO refused, saying they did not have the resources to evacuate anyone but their own staff, and Dr. Buck died. Relevant information included the official involvement of the Government of Sierra Leone, WHOâ€™s response, Dr. Buckâ€™s biography, and identification of other medical fatalities in Sierra Leone. Non-relevant information included biographic details of Dr. Buckâ€™s colleagues beyond their names, medical fatalities in other West Africa countries, and treatment of foreign aid workers.
